characters: OFF THE COAST OF NEW BERK

dialogues.speaker: SQ.101
dialogues.text: A creaking ship in heavy fog. A deck crammed with large cages. Silhouettes of muzzled dragons stir within them. A TRAPPER (IVAR THE WITLESS) walks the deck. A captive drag whines through its muzzle. Ivar hits the cage with his sp shutting it up.

dialogues.speaker: IVAR THE WITLESS
dialogues.text: Quiet! A “CLICK” at the end of the corridor stirs Ivar’s attenti A sword ignites, revealing an arresting figure in black, glistening dragon armor. A helmet and visor hide his face IVAR THE WITLESS (CONT’D) What are you? The DRAGON WARRIOR (HICCUP) raises a finger to his visor.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Shhh. Behind Ivar, TOOTHLESS creeps down from the top of a cage with glowing blue nostrils and dorsal plates, SNARLING. Panicked, Ivar rushes toward Hiccup, trying to get past h Ivar jabs his spear. Hiccup hooks it in his flaming sword deftly disarms him, sending the spear clattering to the d Ivar grabs a hanging lantern and hurls it at Hiccup. It bounces off of his armor and hits the deck, its oil burst into flame. Undaunted, Hiccup steps through it, fire lick off of his fireproof suit.

dialogues.speaker: IVAR THE WITLESS
dialogues.text: Aaaagh! You’re a demon!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Shhh! No, no, I’m not a demon, I’m not a demon. He raises his visor.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? Just a guy! Just a guy here to rescue these dragons. So --  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 2.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Dragon scales! Dragons shed a lot.

dialogues.speaker: IVAR THE WITLESS
dialogues.text: No, I know a demon when I see one! No human legs are that skinny!

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Think that’s a good entrance? An explosion of flame hits the deck as a HIDEOUS ZIPPLEBA (HOOKFANG) lands, engulfed in fire. At it center, SNOTLOU stands in his saddle, dressed in ridiculous Nightmare-the dragon armor, his arms raised in victory. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) Get a load of me! (then, noticing his suit has caught fire) Ahh! AGGH!

dialogues.speaker: IVAR THE WITLESS
dialogues.text: I knew it! MORE DEMONS! Snotlout rushes past, SCREAMING, with his rear aflame.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (exasperated) No, really just a nitwit who forgot to fireproof his butt.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: AGGHH! Hot-hot-hot! Snotlout dives to the deck, rolling to extinguish his smoldering posterior, right into a seeping cloud of green gas, spreading between the cages like dry ice. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) (realizing) Guys, NO! Not yet! CLICK. The gas erupts into a fire ball! The dissipating smoke reveals RUFFNUT and TUFFNUT, striki dramatic poses akin to stage magicians, sloppily dressed Zippleback-themed armor. BARF & BELCH, their twin-headed HIDEOUS ZIPPLEBACK, emerges behind them.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Behold your worst nightmare.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 3.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Behold--

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: --Along with his sister, who insisted on coming.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: That’s my intro?

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Guys, too soon! You always come in too soo--.

dialogues.speaker: --AGGHH
dialogues.text: FISHLEGS crashes down between them with flared, scarab-li wings. He rolls across the deck in heavy Gronckle-themed dragon armor.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry! Still getting the hang of my wings! He rocks on his back like a helpless sea turtle. A baby GRONCKLE (FISHMEAT) pops its head up from Fishlegs’ belly pouch, GURGLING happily.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Fishlegs? Again with the baby? This is a raid.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: I couldn't find a sitter! Ivar seizes his moment and scrambles for the alarm bell.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Demons everywhere!! IT’S THE END OF

dialogues.speaker: THE WORL--
dialogues.text: --CLANG! ASTRID lays him out with a flying side-kick, lan in Nadder-themed dragon armor. STORMFLY, her DEADLY NADDE lands protectively by her side. Hiccup rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Astrid. I had him right where I wanted him. She flips up her visor, flashing a cheeky grin.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 4.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: And now he’s right where I wanted him. Let’s get to work. They spread out toward the dragon-filled cages.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (hushed) Okay, we screwed that up. But at least nobody else knows we're here. AN AERIAL VIEW of the deck shows TENS OF TRAPPERS stealth closing in. The rescue team sets about opening cages and approaching spooked dragons within. Hiccup removes the muzzle from a nervous dragon. He calms it, offering his open hand.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Easy, girl. It’s okay. We’re gonna get you out of here. Fishlegs approaches a massive, antlered dragon in a cage squeals with glee.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: A Crimson Goregutter?! FISHMEAT and the Goregutter eye each other curiously. The baby GURGLES excitedly, causing the giant dragon to crack hint of a smile. Ruffnut rushes up to a cage, containing a tiny, round bea ball of a dragon (a HOBGOBBLER). It watches her, nonpluss

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Hah! Look at this weirdo. Bet it’s super dumb. She tugs at the latch like an idiot, then slaps the bars.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh! Why can’t I get this cage open?! Astrid rushes by, lifting the pin. The cage door swings o

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: It slides.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Psh. Obviously.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 5. Suddenly, TRAPPERS rush toward the rescuers, closing in o all sides.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Attack!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Get the rescues out of here!

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Get that Night Fury! The trappers attack. Hiccup swipes his flaming blade, parrying a blow. Toothless bounds over Hiccup and takes o several trappers at once, deflecting blows with his wings swiping them off of their feet with his tail. Ruffnut and Tuffnut disarm a trapper in a bumbling one-tw and send him crashing into the bars of a cage.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: No running on the deck! It’s slippery. You could fall. Snotlout charges past them, swinging his mace wildly.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Step aside! Let me handle the tough guy stuff! His helmet gets spins on his head, masking his sight as t trappers close in, about to strike his down... «+. aS Hookfang cranes over and blasts fire at them, send them fleeing, covered in flames. Snotlout turns his helme around to see them fleeing. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) Yeah! That’s two for me! A pair of trappers rush toward Fishlegs just as he ducks pick up Fishmeat. One trapper swings right over his head, clocking the othe trapper square in the jaw.

dialogues.speaker: TRAPPER
dialogues.text: Sorry! Before he can react, the Crimson Goregutter’s tail sweeps through, sending him flying. BACK TO HICCUP, as he’s rushed by several trappers in succession.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 6. He uses a cage door to deflect a blow, then yanks it back disarm his attacker. Toothless uses his tail to send the trapper into the cage door, knocking him out cold.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Thank you. Now go get the rest, Bud! ASTRID is dodging blows from a spear-wielding trapper, handily defeating them.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I thought this was supposed to be a stealth mission!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: They always start that way.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Look out! She pushes Hiccup out of the way as a trapper thrusts a s at her. She cleaves off the head of the spear with her ba axe. Stormfly drops in and plucks the trapper out of the fray, dropping him overboard with a SPLASH. ASTRID (0.S.) (CONT’D) Thanks, Stormfly! FROM THE MAST ABOVE, VALKA watches in her warrior armor. dragon, Cloudjumper, sits perched beside her. As they tak the mayhem unfolding below, Cloudjumper turns to Valka, GRUMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: Oh, stop worrying. They’1l get it.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON DECK
dialogues.text: SNOTLOUT leaps from the top of a cage with a WAR CRY, but snags his cape on the corner, leaving him dangling helple as trappers close in. FROM THE MAST ABOVE, Valka shakes her head. VALKA (CONT’D) Eventually.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON DECK
dialogues.text: HICCUP raises his visor.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 7.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Rescue team! Move out! We got ‘em all! Ruffnut and Tuffnut are encircled by trappers, all brandishing weapons. The Twins raise their hands in surrender. Barf and Belch suddenly pluck them out of the fray, airlifting them to safety.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: I’m gonna headlock every last one of you! I might even leg-lock you. HOOKFANG swoops in and grabs Snotlout from where he dangl flying him out of the battle.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Amateurs! I was just getting started! ASTRID runs to the railing, yelling to the remaining rescuers.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Clear out, guys! Go! Go! FISHLEGS flees from pursuing trappers and dives over the railing of the boat, seemingly into the water below. He reappears, riding his GRONCKLE backwards.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Woohoo! ON TOOTHLESS, rushing down a row of cages, checking for stragglers. He senses something stirring in a locked cage peers inside, curious and sniffing, but sees nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Toothless! Time to go! Toothless rushes off. Inside the cage, a piercing pair of blue eyes open on an otherwise invisible dragon. ON HICCUP, awaiting Toothless by the railing. He turns to find the remaining trappers angrily surrounding him. He i painfully outnumbered.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh... hey guys. Suddenly, from behind them, trappers start flying into th air. Toothless barrels through them like bowling pins, rushing toward Hiccup. He scoops Hiccup onto his saddle a takes wing, escaping into the fog...  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 8.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ha! You always have my back, bud. +. And leaving the battered, smoldering ship behind, relieved of its cargo. Ivar wearily watches them escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8Q.201 - “Berk Overcrowded, Part 1” PULLING through a flurry of wings -- a curtain of swirlin color... .-+. Unveiling Hiccup and the RESCUE TEAM returning from raid, leading the group of freed dragons. Hiccup turns in the saddle, revealing bustling Berk in th background -- a hive of activity. Literally hundreds of dragons in movement.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: This... is Berk! Your new home away from home. A stunning one-stop, all- expense-paid dream destination! They fly into the clustered, overbuilt village skyline. Dragons are perched on every available rooftop, greeting arriving newbies with excitement. They take flight, follo the returning rescue party in a parade of color.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So settle in and let your worries melt away! The service here soars, the cuisine’s fiery... A dragon roasts a rack of meat for a Viking cook. The who hut catches fire. A Scauldron flies by and douses it with blast of water. Gothi cuts across their path, wilding riding her staff li witch’s broom carried by terrible terrors.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ++. and the locals are as colorful as you get! The ground is crawling with dragons of every kind. So man that no actual ground is visible.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 9. Vikings travel to and fro by hopping from dragon to drago like a giant game of Frogger.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Any run-of-the-mill paradise boasts beaches and sunshine. Well, not us. We've got something no one else can touch. We, my friend, have dragons! Lots and LOTS of dragons! They land on the dragon elevator in the center of the upp plaza. The crowd of Vikings scatter, moving out of the wa the new dragon arrivals. Two sheep dressed as dragons continue grazing as the shadow of the gigantic new dragon comes across them. They panic and run off, leaving their dragon costumes behind. Toothless and Hiccup hop off of the elevator and onto the crowded plaza.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gang, meet our latest Berkians! “OOHS” and “AHHS” sound from the crowd. The CRIMSON GOREGUTTER surveys his new surroundings as Berkians put t hands out to greet it.

dialogues.speaker: VIKING
dialogues.text: Welcome to paradise, mate! The Rescue Team lands, followed by the overwhelmed newbie Berkians and dragons alike surround the new dragons, givi them a heroes’ welcome.

dialogues.speaker: PHLEGMA
dialogues.text: Aren’t you a beauty!

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Oh, you're welcome. You’re welcome. I took on, like a hundred trappers, a thousand trappers.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: All with burning undies. She SNICKERS. Tuffnut pops off his helmet. Surrounding Vikings and dragons recoil from the stench.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: My thick, full beard almost caught on fire. He strokes his “beard,” which is actually his hair, braid around his face.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 10.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Ugh. Just... just stop. Snotlout saunters up to Valka, puffing his chest out.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: So, Hiccup’s Mom, any notes on my bone-crushing assault, or was it pretty much perfect?

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: Oh, it was... indescribable. And please, call me Valka. It has been a year. She walks off to inspect the newly freed dragons, leaving Snotlout grinning from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: (amazed, under his breath) First name basis. Hiccup mashes Toothless’ cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: I think the real hero of the day was Toothless. Isn’t that right, Bud? What would we do without you, oh King of Dragons? What would we do? Astrid hops out of Stormfly’s saddle, rolling her neck.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Well, we could train a lot harder, for one. That was pretty sloppy. Valka looks over smiling.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: (phrasing it delicately) Astrid does have a point. Perhaps you all rely a little bit too much on your dragons... and not enough on one another.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: See, that’s exactly what I was saying! Just listen up, guys. Astrid rolls her eyes. Snotlout saunters up to Hiccup.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 11. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) Yep, your Mom’s super impressed with me. I’m like the son she always wanted. Fishmeat hops out of Fishlegs’ pouch and scurries over to giant Crimson Goregutter.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Fishmeat! You found a new friend! Fishmeat dances at the Goregutter’s feet. In response, th Goregutter pounces playfully, clumsily slamming into the towering totem.

dialogues.speaker: VIKINGS
dialogues.text: Mind your heads! It cracks, teeters, and collapses. Vikings HOLLER and div for cover. Dragons take to the air. The totem smashes int “bird house” structure, creating a chain effect of collap buildings. The last to topple goes over the cliff. Hiccup and Toothless cringe, as Gobber pushes through the crowd, looking more disheveled than ever.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: What good is having the King of Dragons around if he can’t keep the order? Hiccup turns to Toothless.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Hey, bud? You wanna... do something here, or...? Toothless calls the Goregutter into line with a roar. He respectfully. The baby Gronckle scurries off, intimidated

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: And where do you suppose we put these ones?!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Oh, we'll make room. He turns to see the beachball-sized Hobgobbler staring blankly at him. He GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Ah! You brought back a Hobgobbler?! They’re a bad omen. We’re cursed!  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 12. Valka scoops up the Hobgobbler, looking it over affectionately.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: Nonsense. What harm could he do? It never takes its eyes off of Gobber. VALKA (CONT’D) No injuries. They’re all a little shaken but otherwise healthy. (to the rescues) Now, who’s hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seq.211 - Berk Overcrowded Pt 2

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT HALL
dialogues.text: The Berk equivalent to a crowded cafeteria. Dragons and Vikings crammed in together, filling every space, sprawle out on tables, hanging off of chandeliers. Hiccup and Toothless enter last, with Gobber hobbling alongside, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Point is, you can’t keep bringing dragons back here. As Gobber and Hiccup make their way through the crowd of dragons and people, SNOTLOUT runs by with his dragon.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Come on, boy! Hiccup and Gobber wait for them to pass, then continue walking.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: You're just asking for trouble. Hiccup throws a hand in front of Gobber, stopping him fro stepping forward. A mischievous dragon scampers past, wit burly viking in close pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: VIKING
dialogues.text: No you don’t, you little thief! Hiccup and Gobber wait for them to pass, then resume.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 13.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Those trappers are getting closer by the day.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: We can handle them. We have the Alpha. Isn’t that right, Bud? (beat) Would you look at how happy they are? Gobber grumbles as they navigate the chaotic hall, dodgin Gothi as she flies by, carried by dragons. Valka is arm wrestling the brawny Spitelout. She wins. RACK FOCUS to reveal Snotlout watching in slack jawed awe.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: She's... awesome. Hiccup throws an arm around Gobber as they join the lunch line. Stew is ladled into heaping bowls and handed off to hungry arrivals.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Gobber! Relax, we did it. The world’s first dragon-Viking utopia. We made the dream a reality!

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Your dream, maybe. Mine’s less crowded and more -- AGHH! The Hobgobbler bobs up, basking in the steaming cauldron stew.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sanitary.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Gobber! You’re not fooling anybody. I know you love them. Toothless calls the young dragon out of the stew pot with low growl. The newbie crawls out and slinks off, sheepish Hiccup and Gobber carry their filled bowls to the head ta and squeeze in between Astrid and Valka, crushing them.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: You’re supposed to be the generation that leads us into the future.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 14. He looks around at the Gang. Tuffnut picks his teeth whil Belch steals his food. Snotlout starts a food fight with Hookfang.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Ha! Food fight! Ruffnut vapidly gazes at her reflection in a tankard...

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Gor-ge-ous. ... then gets hit with a turkey leg. She joins the food fight.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch the hair! All the while, Fishlegs feeds Fishmeat in a highchair, ma dragon sounds as he flies in a spoonful of stew to its op mouth.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Good Fishmeat! On-nom-nom-nom. Gobber gets hit with a lump of food. He wipes it off, glowering.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Ugh. Thor help us. He grabs Astrid and Hiccup, pulling them together in a headlock.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Time to stop worrying about problems out there and start sorting out the ones right here.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Gobber...

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (squeezed under his arm) Okay, okay, I’1l think about it.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Hang up those saddles and get married. A pregnant pause. The GANG gawk at the mention of marriag

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: The “M” word.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 15.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Gross. (beat) Unless it’s me.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Start ruling like a proper royal couple. Hiccup grimaces, his face pressed into Gobber’s armpit. Gobber whispers into Astrid’s ear.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marry him, please. You’re the only one with any sense around here. With you wearing the pants, there’s still hope. Astrid peels away, awkwardly recoiling at the proposition

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Wow! Not awkward at all. Thanks for that, Gobber!

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Astrid... don’t be like that! Hiccup pops his head out of Gobber’s armpit, GASPING for Tuffnut comes up behind Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Whoa. That is a definitive no. Look, if you need a beard to cry on, just lean on my shoulder and you can cry into my full, thick beard. He pulls Hiccup’s face into his filthy “beard.”

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (muffled) Oh, thank you, Tuffnut. Thank you... so much. Eret approaches and coughs awkwardly as Tuffnut clutches Hiccup in his beard.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (muffled) Eret, son of Eret! What’s the report?  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 16.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Two more trapper barges spotted in the strait.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (optimistic) So we go after them! Hiccup turns to Gobber, leering back, judgmentally.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: One day, you’re going to pick a fight you can’t win. Hiccup grimaces back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8Q.221 - Grimmel’s Deal

dialogues.speaker: A FLYING P.O.V
dialogues.text: «+. Soars over a congested harbor, cluttered with warship reflection in the passing water below reveals the source bizarre, quad-armed airship, flown by four red-bellied dragons. A pair of dragon scouts lead the way, speeding over spraw network of wooden docks toward a bustling military base. Smoke hangs in the air, billowing from blacksmith chimney Store houses and barracks weave toward a hilltop arena, b within the ruins of a Stonehenge-like druidic circle. The airship hovers to a landing atop the hill, scattering slack-jawed soldiers. The dragons HISS, commanding a wide berth. These DEATHGRIPPERS are monstrous brutes, bulging armored back plates and blood-red underbellies. In place front legs, they scuttle on bulky, serrated pincers. GRIMMEL, 55, descends from the cockpit, tall, slender, an dressed head to toe in black, scaly leather. Grimmel enters a stone archway, flanked by his pair of Deathgripper scouts. Soldiers watch him keenly, hands gripping their sword hilts. Archers above follow his ever move, bows drawn, as they whisper a warning to each other  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 17.

dialogues.speaker: ARCHER
dialogues.text: Deathgrippers. Grimmel and his pair of Deathgrippers disappear into the tunnel leading us into...

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS ARENA
dialogues.text: .+. The size of the Colosseum. Sooty stone walls rise imposingly from a scorched dirt floor. A spider web-like of steel forms an impenetrable ceiling. Along its walls, a small collection of dragons lay stuffe into undersized cages, while at the center of the arena, enormous dragon is tethered in place. SOLDIERS brandishin shields and spears poke at the unruly beast. It ROARS thr muzzled jaws and thrashes its club tail in retaliation, swiping soldiers off of their feet. The pair of Deathgrippers emerge from the tunnel into the arena. They HISS, eyeing the captive dragons. Tusks exten from their heavy jaws. The training ring mayhem turns eer quiet. The captive dragons shiver and shrink to backs of their cages as the Deathgrippers pass. The unruly large dragon at the center grows still, averting its eyes from stalking predators.

dialogues.speaker: ON A NEARBY DAIS
dialogues.text: A trio of WARLORDS (two males, one female) in unblemished decorative armor, hover over a map. Ivar The Witless (fro the opening scene) positions a small ship upon the table.

dialogues.speaker: IVAR
dialogues.text: The dragon riders attacked us here, off the Eastern Strait. RAGNAR THE ROCK drives another boat piece into it, mouthi CRASH. The others glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHAGHATAI KHAN
dialogues.text: Ragnar. He stifles his amusement.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Uh. Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: My dear warlords. They part to reveal Grimmel behind them, grinning as he p back his hood, exposing a shock of white hair.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 18.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How go your plans to conquer the world? Ragnar goes to embrace him with open arms.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: Ha! Grimmel! My old friend! Thank you for coming-- A Deathgripper pins him to ground. He YELPS. Grimmel look around, nonchalantly.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: A year since Drago’s defeat and no further along with your dragon army, I see. Griselda The Grevious glares, sourly.

dialogues.speaker: GRISELDA THE GREVIOUS
dialogues.text: You can thank the young chief of Berk for that.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Stoick’s boy? Ragnar peeks out, still pinned under the Deathgripper.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: (straining under the weight of the dragon) He and his peace-loving dragon riders continue to raid our ships and steal our dragons.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Hmph. That does sound like a nuisance. But I’m in the business of killing dragons, not retrieving them. He turns to leave, signaling the Deathgripper to follow. Ragnar sits up, catching his breath.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: But, Grimmel...

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: The idiot boy has done all of the work for you, gathering the dragons in one place. Why bother me?  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 19.

dialogues.speaker: CHAGHATAI
dialogues.text: Because the flock is protected by a Night Fury. Grimmel stop in his tracks.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Not possible.

dialogues.speaker: CHAGHATAI
dialogues.text: It seems one slipped through your fingers. He glares, but Ragnar gets between them, forcing a smile.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: Look, Berk's dragons will follow their alpha, so we'll pay you to capture him and bring the flock to us. Grimmel considers the proposition. In the background, his Deathgrippers antagonize the retrained Rumblehorn, nippin it while it thrashes against its chains.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sweetening the deal) We even have your favorite bait.

dialogues.speaker: CHAGHATAT
dialogues.text: The only dragon they left us from last night's raid. They gesture to a nearby cage. A white dragon lies curled by the back bars. Grimmel approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: A female? Hmmm.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: So do we have a deal? Old friend? Suddenly, the Rumblehorn breaks free and charges for the exit, directly in the path of Grimmel and the warlords. T scatter, but Grimmel stands his ground, effortlessly firi his crossbow and bringing it down.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: When all is said and done, this young chief will bring me the Night Fury. In the resulting dust cloud, Grimmel pulls his foot from under its snoring snout. Grimmel turns with a smile.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 20.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They don’t have a leader. Just a boy. He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQ.251 - FLASHBACK #1 - “Our Home”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide-eyed boy, 5, with rosy cheeks and a scar on his ch He stares ahead, wind buffeting his hair.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hiccup. This is Berk, son. It’s our home. PULL BACK to reveal YOUNG HICCUP in STOICK’S arms. They’r standing on a high lookout, taking in the village with it defense towers and catapults.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was the home of your grandparents, and their grandparents before them. It’s my job as chief to protect us, Hiccup. And one day, when you’re all grown up, that job will be passed onto you.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (awed whisper) Okay. Stoick points to the setting sun on the open sea.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK
dialogues.text: It’s very important, son, because... out there, beyond the sunset, lies the home of the dragons. Hiccup looks up at Stoick in awe.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Wow.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 21.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK
dialogues.text: Aye. Legends tell of ships that sailed too close to it, only to drop off the edge of the world, never to be seen again. (beat) But those sailors who turned back told tales of a great waterfall and dragons guarding the entrance to a Hidden World.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK
dialogues.text: Not just a nest, Hiccup, but a land from which all dragons come.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Even... Night Furies? Stoick smiles.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK
dialogues.text: Especially Night Furies.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Those are scary. Hiccup turns back to the sunset, gawking in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: STOICK
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry. One day, I'll find the Hidden World and seal it up, so that people and dragons will fight no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence 0351 - “Our Home, Part 2” CLOSE ON Hiccup, staring into the sunset, brow furrowed, hair buffeted in the wind. Toothless shuffles up, WHIMPERING.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: What? Toothless responds with a cute, pleading stare.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 22.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, all right. He reaches down and unbuckles his prothetic leg.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You do know, it’s not a chew toy, don’t you? Toothless gets into a dog-like play position -- crouched on his forelegs with his rear in the air. He dances aroun excitedly. Hiccup holds up the leg, waving it tauntingly.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is this what you want? Oh, do you want this leg? Do you want my leg? He tosses it over the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go get it! Toothless bounds after it, leaping off of the cliff, and gliding wobbly after the leg as it plummets. He nabs it i his jaws and throws open his wings, rising again. Hiccup smiles, then removes his map, unfolding it as he b to his knees. He studies the archipelago, biting his lip. Suddenly, his prosthetic leg drops onto the map, bouncing splattering slobber over the parchment. He glances up to Toothless, riding the updraft with a loc flared mechanical tail.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Getting pretty good at gliding on your own, Bud. Toothless lands, panting happily. He nudges the prostheti leg closer, as Hiccup tries to concentrate. Suddenly, Stormfly bursts into view, blotting out Hiccup’ view of the sunset. She hovers above Hiccup, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (projected) Oh, so this is where you come to get away from Gobber? Hiccup CHUCKLES.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 23.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: I have no idea what you’re talking about. She hops off of Stormfly, smiling knowingly. Toothless ru to her with the slobbery prosthetic leg.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Ewww. She takes it and lobs it over the cliff. Toothless bounds after it. Astrid wipes her hands on Hiccup’s shoulder in passing and plops down at the edge of the cliff, dangling legs off of it.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, he’s right, you know. Hiccup lights up, a goofy smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Really? You think you and I should...

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Oh, gods no. We’re nowhere near ready for that. Hiccup grimaces, hiding his hurt.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: No, that-that’s crazy...

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: I mean he’s right about all of this. She gestures to the village below. Hiccup SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: It does seem like the whole world knows about us now.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Yup. And the more dragons we bring back here, the bigger of a target we become. Toothless drops the prosthetic leg on her lap. She tosses again and he dives after it, happily.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wish there was some way to make them leave us alone.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 24.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: There might be. She twists around, meeting his eyes, quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dad used to talk about an old mariners’ myth, of a secret land at the edge of the world where dragons live totally out of reach. Astrid CHUCKLES, dismissive.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Well, sailors are known for tall tales.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: True. But what if it’s real? It could be the answer to all of our problems.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: How? By moving the dragons there? Hiccup shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Uh uh. All of us. She stares, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Seriously. And abandon our home of seven generations? The home your father left you to protect? Pregnant pause. Hiccup shrugs and stammers.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think we need a real solution, Hiccup. Toothless lands and begins gnawing on the leg. Stormfly hovers, eyeing it, jealous.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (lightening the mood) Well, we could just take Gobber’s advice and tie the knot. That should fix everything. She rolls her eyes at him.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 25.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (playfully) But hey... if you’re having doubts about yours truly, I’m pretty sure Snotlout’s available.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: He only has eyes for your Mom. Hiccup GASPS in mock insult and pulls her into a bearhug.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Oh, you’re playing dirty now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: (laughing) You asked for it! Looks like there might be a wedding after all!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (struggling) How dare you! That is a low blow. No, no, you’re not getting away... She grabs his arm and twists it behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aghh! Okay, okay! You win! You win! You always win. She GIGGLES and settles into an embrace.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: You knew what you were getting into.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Right. IN THE BACKGROUND, Toothless’ ear plates perk up. He drop the prosthetic leg and raises his head, twitching his ear He gets to his feet and shuffles to the edge of the cliff staring off into the forest below. Hiccup turns toward hi

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uh, Bud? Toothless suddenly bounds off of the cliff, gliding and bounding into the distance. Hiccup gets up and hops to the edge of the cliff.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 26.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, don’t bother to wait for us! Toothless continues into the distance, without looking ba

dialogues.speaker: SQ. 401
dialogues.text: Toothless weaves between trunks, following a distant MOAN Drips from the past rainstorm patter all around. Mist blankets the forest floor. Twigs snap under his weight. Suddenly, the mournful call ceases. Toothless sniffs the and pushes his snout through the underbrush. His glisteni eyes widen in amazement. Ahead, in a small clearing, a shape shifts in the dappled moonlight. Its body shimmers in beads of rainwater, plung back into mystery as shadows consume it. Toothless GURGLES. The groggy dragon (the Light Fury) slowly raises its head Details reveal themselves slowly -- a sleek and smooth creature, with long folded wings, feline features, and -- even in the dark -- iridescent scales of pure white. Toothless watches, mesmerized as... FROM TOOTHLESS’ P.O.V.: In SLOW MOTION, the white dragon slowly turns to face him giving us our first real look at her. Piercing blue eyes upon him. Her head is smooth and elegant -- strikingly similar to a Night Fury, but lacking Toothless’ crown. Tw stubby ear plates lay folded back. ON TOOTHLESS, awestruck, babbling in SLOW MOTION. He take cautious step forward. She recoils and yowls back: “Get out of here. It’s a trap She snarls at the ground between them. Toothless stops in tracks, looks down at the area, and steps around it, givi it a wide berth. He comes within a couple of feet of her. His lips crackle apart into a big, reassuring smile. He c “It’s okay.”  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 27. Toothless inches closer. Her grogginess fades, her guardedness subsides. They hold the stare. For a moment, there is only the sound of their purrs, falling into sync SNAP. A twig breaks. She stirs from the stare and jolts h head to the right, spotting Hiccup and then Astrid pushin through the brush. She jumps back, alarmed. ON HICCUP AND ASTRID, gaping in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Oh my gods.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Hiccup! The white dragon blasts! Hiccup and Astrid dive out of th way. The violet fireball hits the tree trunk between them shattering it and bringing down the top in a thunderous crash. Toothless balks: “Stop!” She turns to him, confused, and swallows the blast. She balks back: “But they’re humans!” Hiccup and Astrid raise their heads from the underbrush, covered in splinters and looking startled.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah we're friends! No need to kill us! Spooked, the white dragon lunges into the air, crashing through the tree tops in a rainfall of branches and pine needles. Toothless cries out: “No! Come back!” He bounds up a tree trunk to the top in pursuit. But it’s no use. She looks back one last time, then blast fireball and flies through it, pulling a comet trail of flame. When it tapers to nothing, the dragon is gone, vanishing into thin air. Hiccup and Astrid gape, astounded.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Another Night Fury. Astrid smiles, thoroughly amazed.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 28.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: No, not quite. It’s more like a... HICCUP (CONT’D) ASTRID Bright... Fury. Light Fury.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yours is better, probably. BACK TO TOOTHLESS, scanning the empty sky from the treeto crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQ.501 - Tale of the Light Fury TOOTHLESS, eyeing the sky, lovesick, from the entrance of Berk’s cavern stables. The cave is a flurry of activity. Astrid and the Gang are busy at work, feeding dragons, cleaning stalls. Ruffnut watches Toothless, who is still staring dumbstruck into t distance.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: What do you mean, “gone?”

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Vanished, into thin air. Hiccup is seated at a stool, carefully removing a splinte from a Gronckle’s foot. Fishlegs bounces over with the baby Gronckle in his backp showing Hiccup a new dragon card he’s been working on.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. Stubbier ears. No dorsal plates.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Okay, got it. Fishlegs nods and makes a few adjustments as Eret walks p hauling a bundle of fresh hay into a clean stall.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 29.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: What a night! Toothless nudges Hiccup, growing ever more impatient.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Bud, what’s gotten into you? What is all this slobbering and panting? Astrid rubs Toothless’ muzzle playfully.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Isn’t it obvious? He’s in love!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (privately, to Toothless) Trust me. Relationships are nothing but pain and misery. Astrid punches him. He recoils and gestures at Astrid, sa to Toothless:

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did I just say? Toothless resumes prancing around, unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Am I not enough? Toothless stares blankly, frothing and panting, then bolt away.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: I think that’s a no. Toothless spots a pair of Nadders enacting a courtship display. He wanders over, curious, as Fishlegs appears at Hiccup’s side with the revised card. It’s a mess of smudg pencil lines.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Something like this?

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (exasperated) You know what? Just trace your Toothless card and make her white.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: You could’ve led with that. Fishlegs nods, hobbling away.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 30.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Can you believe it? Toothless has a girlfriend!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: I never took you for a romantic. Like, ever.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: But it’s so sweet. I mean... look. She gestures to Toothless, now privately practicing the Nadders’ courtship display with his own shadow. He extend his wings and throws his head back, CLUCKING awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Okay. That’s just sad. And weird.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Yeah, you better do something.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Seriously. I’d rather shovel poop all day than watch that. Hiccup SIGHS. Pulls the splinter form the dragon’s foot a set it down.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: All right, let’s head back to the woods and see if we can find her. Toothless bounds over excitedly, smothering Hiccup in lic Tuffnut sets down his broom and joins.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Ah, good idea. A little privacy.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Shhh. (to the others) It’s boy talk.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: C’mon. Let's go work this out.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) He grins and ushers Hiccup out of the stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQ.751 - “Someone’s Here, Part 1”

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: So, you want to get married. 31.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Tuffnut and Hiccup shuffle through the woods on the way b to the clearing. Toothless sniffs the ground ahead of the focused.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Uh, no, actually. Tuffnut swings a stick at the underbrush.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Good news -- I’ve been to two weddings, crashed both. But none as high profile as this one. Lots of pressure. Judgement. And not just by me.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Look we talked about it. We’re not getting married. Tuffnut CHUCKLES, knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Cold feet. I’ve seen it before. But don’t worry, Little Hiccy... He puts his hand on Hiccup’s shoulder. Locks eyes in a sympathetic stare.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m here.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Wait, Hiccy...?

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Now I’ve seen the way Astrid looks at you. Everyone has. That doubt. That not-so-subtle disappointment. That longing for something more. Than you. You need to focus on being worthy. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 32.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, she’s a warrior queen, for Thor’s sake, and you are... neither. But with me as your best man, your spirit guide if you will, you'll learn to embrace your inner Viking. Show these naysayers, of which there are many, that you’re more than just a malnourished runt with bad hair, strange teeth, and a twig for a neck.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: You're really bad at pep talks.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Stop letting these insecurities get the best of you! Everyone’s watching. I mean, everyone. You need to man up. Do as I do. They enter the clearing. No sign of the Light Fury. Tooth SIGHS, disappointed. TUFFNUT (0.S.) (CONT’D) It‘ll be hard, but you have my word. And until I break that word, I won’t give up. Hiccup spots something glimmering in the brush at the far of the clearing. He approaches, curious.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Hey! What, am I wasting my time here?! You see some shiny thing in the woods -- ooh, what is that? Hiccup reaches down and retrieves a discarded dart contai a glass vial. Hiccup furrows his brow, studying it. A sin drop of green fluid drips from the end of the barb. He whips around to see Toothless sniffing leaves and pine needles near the center of the clearing.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (panicked) Toothless! Toothless recoils in response, eyeing Hiccup, confused. Hiccup holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (tense) Don’t move a muscle.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 33. Hiccup glances around the clearing, spotting an undisturb area at the center of it. He reaches for Tuffnut’s walkin stick and hurls it like a spear into the center.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Hey! It sticks its landing, then... CLANG! In an EXPLOSION of debris, two giant iron jaws SNAP SHUT in the air like a g bear trap, obliterating the stick that triggered it. Hiccup leaps backward as the trap rings out into the fore Toothless ROARS, startled. Hiccup looks left and right, scanning the forest with flared, paranoid eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. BERK - BLACKSMITH’S STALL - LATER SQ.851 - “Someone’s here, Part 2” Hiccup sets the dart down on a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Someone’s here. Hiccup and Tuffnut stand facing Astrid, Eret, and Gobber, work in the stall.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Eh?

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: He managed to slip past our scouts and lay a trap in the woods.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: It ruined boy talk! Tuffnut tosses the dart, nearly stabbing Eret.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Let me at him!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Slow down, Gobber. Let’s get a search team on the ground and scouts in the air. Toothless and I will fly the coastline. Eret inspects the dart closely, turning it over.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 34.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wouldn’t advise taking Toothless anywhere, Chief. I know this handiwork. Grimmel the Grisly. Famous back where I’m from. Smartest dragon hunter I ever met -- well, next to me, of course.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Can't be that smart. He left his trap unmanned.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Nothing’s accidental when it comes to Old Grimmel. He lives for the hunt. To get inside the mind of his prey, to control its every choice. It’s all a game to him. Hiccup glances at Toothless, eyeing the sky, lovesick.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Well, he doesn’t know who he’s playing with.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we’ve dealt with his kind before.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Don’t underestimate him, Hiccup. Mark my words. He’1ll be back.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Then we’ll be waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. HICCUP’S HOUSE - NIGHT SQ.951 - Grimmel Pays A Visit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tattered, leather-bound book on a shelf, flanked by sev others. Hiccup pulls it out and blows off the dust. He ta it to the fireplace, where several old maps are spread ou the floor. He sits cross-legged and opens the book, leafing through scribbled notes. He mumbles the words and glances at the maps, showing detailed explorations of the seas west of B  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 35.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (murmuring to himself) Alright, come on, give me a clue here. Give me a clue, Dad. He looks up -- Toothless is snoring in a shadowy corner o the room. He hears a creak. Turns to the door. Nothing. He watches for a moment, then return his gaze to the book on his lap He hears a gurgle -- water pouring from a jug into a cup. Hiccup jumps to his feet, alarmed. The sound of SLURPING follows.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Oh, I hope you don’t mind if I help myself? Mmm. This is quite good. Hiccup extends and lights his Dragon Blade, illuminating figure standing in the shadows of his kitchen -- tall and lean, covered head to toe in black leather. Grimmel sips calmly.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: That is impressive. But let me finish my drink. Toothless stirs. In a flash, Grimmel immediately fires a from his crossbow, putting him out with a YELP.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toothless! Hiccup rushes over to Toothless as Grimmel tosses his cup the floor and reloads his crossbow, aiming it at Hiccup w he stands.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What did you do to him?

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Ehh. Nothing that he won’t sleep off. He crosses the room, crossbow in hand, and sits in Stoick chair by the fire. He strokes the wooden armrest.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah. May I? He peels off his hood.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 36.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Chief Hiccup? Do I say Chief Hiccup? (hiccuping) Or do I call you Hiccup? What do you prefer? A pregnant pause. Hiccup stares.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have no idea who I am, do you? (beat) Well, your father knew of me. Now there was a chief! One of the greatest dragon hunters to have ever lived. (cringing) What would he think of you? Grimmel CHUCKLES.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He had it right, you know, making it his mission to destroy the beasts so that you could grow up in a better world.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: He changed his mind.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: And look where that got him. Hiccup glares at the spiteful jab.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, let’s get to the point. I am the Night Fury killer. I’ve hunted every last one but yours. You are going to give me that dragon, or -

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: I will never give him up. Grimmel rises from his chair, laughing as he pushes Hiccu Dragon Blade aside. He struts past Hiccup, toward Toothle

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: You wish dragons to live free, among us, like equals? A toxic notion, my boy. History has shown that we are the superior species. What if word of your misguided ideas were to spread?  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 37. He nears Toothless, growing suspicious...

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It would be the undoing of civilization as... we... know... it. Hmmm... .-. and kicks him. Toothless stirs, his “head” falling of revealing Fishlegs in disguise.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: (groggy) Did we get him? Hiccup hooks Grimmel’s crossbow with the tip of his Drago Blade and casts it aside.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Now! Suddenly, Valka, Astrid, and Gobber rush out of hiding, leaping from the loft above and bursting through the door

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Sorry to barge in! Grimmel looks around, surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: You think you can come into my home, sit in my father’s chair, and threaten my dragon? (beat) This is Berk. And we have defended our way of life from far worse than you. Grimmel smiles.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Ooh, a fighting spirit! I love it. Only, I’m afraid you’re mistaken. You've never seen anything like me. He whistles, summoning his Deathgrippers. In response, serrated pincers puncture and tear through t roof, knocking Astrid off the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Astrid, look out! The Deathgripper lunges forward, aiming its poisonous sti straight at them.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 38.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: Look out! Son! Get clear! Glops of flaming acid rain down, dissolving everything on contact as several Deathgrippers drop to the floor. Grimm calmly retrieves his crossbow.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Run! Gobber pulls Fishlegs out of harm’s way as flaming ceilin timbers collapse, nearly crushing them. Everyone dives fo cover in the inferno.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Have my dragon ready when I return... or I will destroy everything you love. Hiccup looks around through the swirling smoke and embers seeing shapes take flight through the open ceiling. Our heroes rush out after the, but Grimmel is gone. Hiccup and Valka exchange shaken glances against the back of burning buildings.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BERK
dialogues.text: SQ.1001 - HICCUP’S PLAN OUTSIDE, a dark and stormy night. A loud, fussy crowd sou from inside the Great Hall. INSIDE, All of Berk’s Vikings are gathered. Hiccup stands before them at the head table, with Toothless safely by h side.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Alright, alright everybody! Settle down, please! (turning to Fishlegs) Fishlegs, have you ever seen that species of dragon before? Fishlegs is slumped at a table. He sits up, raises his fi in the air to speak, then falls over, passing out again.

dialogues.speaker: SPITELOUT
dialogues.text: Let me at him!  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 39.

dialogues.speaker: HOARK
dialogues.text: I'll give him a piece of my mind! And by mind, I mean fists. He PUNCHES OUT the Viking next to him. The crowd ROARS in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Did you miss the part where we almost died? Have you seen my house? (beat) This is a new kind of enemy. And I underestimated him. Now that’s on me. But I will not do that again.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: We're Vikings! We don’t run froma fight. At least I don’t. (accusingly, to Eret) You might. Eret throws him a baffled glare.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: I agree with Hiccup. We haven’t seen the last of Grimmel. He’s a predator. Single minded and patient. He won’t stop until he gets what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: I’m with Eret. We have to take this threat seriously. She nods to Eret. RACK FOCUS to Snotlout, fuming.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Grimmel is just a sign of the times. Our enemies are getting smarter, more determined. We’re not just overcrowded, we’re exposed and vulnerable. (beat) Short of full blown war and risking everyone we love, I don’t... I don’t see a way of staying here any longer. Indignant PROTESTS sound out from the agitated crowd. Ast sinks her axe into the table, silencing them.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 40.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Hey! Hear him out. She gives Hiccup an encouraging nod. He grins, appreciati of the support.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: If we want to live in peace, with our dragons, we need a better plan.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: So, what are you saying, Chief? Hiccup looks out over his people, taking a BREATH.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: I’m saying we have to disappear, off the map. Take the dragons to a place where no one will find them.

dialogues.speaker: HOARK
dialogues.text: And where might that be?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: He’s talking about a quest for Hidden World.

dialogues.speaker: PHLEGMA
dialogues.text: The hidden what? Ruffnut cackles.

dialogues.speaker: RUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Out to lunch.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: My father was obsessed with it when I was a boy. He made notes and maps in search of the ancestral home of all dragons, tucked away somewhere beyond the edge of the world. It may be the solution we need. (beat) We're dragon people. It’s where we belong. Fussy MURMUR builds anew. Hiccup takes in the glum, disapproving faces.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, I know this is our home. My father left me to protect it. (beat) But Berk is more than this place. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 41.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We are Berk. The people, the dragons. I say Berk is wherever we go. Silence. Suddenly, Tuffnut throws up his fists.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: I’m with him! Who else?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SQ. 1091 - The Quest Gone West The entire Berkian flock of dragons cruises through a glorious cloudscape of towering cumulous skyscrapers, hau their riders and everything they can carry -- including a entire Viking ship loaded with supplies, and one loaded w sheep, dressed in dragon costumes. One of them exchanges nervous look with a passing Monstrous Nightmare. Hiccup is at the head of the pack. A flurry of dragons an riders follow him into the distance, over miles of endles sea, toward a late, setting sun. The horizon is gleaming bright, filled with promise. The crowd of dragons and their riders are parted by Fishl who uncomfortably makes his way through the crowd with th screaming baby Gronckle on his back.

dialogues.speaker: FISHLEGS
dialogues.text: Ah, excuse me, coming through...let me just get right through here. Fishmeat look! Eat your rocks, eat your rocks!

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Gods! People who fly with babies are the worst! Fishmeat burps up a slug of molten lava, barely missing Snotlout’s head, Gobber pushes through the front line of the formation, pa Valka and Astrid, toward Hiccup. He eyes the horizon, the turns to Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m always asking you this question but - Suddenly, he starts to dip below frame.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 42.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WHOA! Wake up, Grump! Wake up! Is there an actual plan or--

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: -- just keep flying until we reach the end of the world. Gobber eyes the horizon again, grimacing.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Ah. Seems... sensible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive armada is gathered offshore. Berk is lies completely deserted. Sign of a hasty departure everywhere Grimmel sits at the base of the Stoick statue, munching a apple skewered from the tip of his dagger. A map is sprea out at his feet. He ponders it, casually chewing. His Deathgrippers HISS and gather as the warlords approac mounting the steps as they take in the abandoned village. Below, their soldiers spread out, searching the buildings

dialogues.speaker: CHAGHATAI KHAN
dialogues.text: So? Where are they? Grimmel holds up his hands, gesturing to the surroundings

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Gone, obviously.

dialogues.speaker: GRISELDA THE GREVIOUS
dialogues.text: The Night Fury escaped you? Again? Grimmel smiles. Takes another bite from the apple.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: I encouraged it! They’ve abandoned their only defensible position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flock of dragons continue flying toward the horizon a hear GRIMMEL’S VOICEOVER.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 43.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Running scared, with what little they can carry. Snotlout pulls up on the other side of them, stretched ou Hookfang like he’s riding a Harley.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Ugh! It just keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: That’s ‘cause the world is actually round. Hiccup SIGHS, exasperated. Astrid and Valka giggle.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Sun’s round. The Moon’s round. Stars are round. Even though they’re small and stupid. Ruffnut SNICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right? Stars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimmel continues to pace, placating the restless warlord

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Don’t fret. They won’t get far. The Night Fury is distracted. I introduced him to your female. He sticks his apple core on one of the Deathgripper’s tus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Toothless’ ear plates perk up.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Furies mate for life, you see. He looks around, curious, tilting his plates like antenna

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Whatcha picking up on, Bud?  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 44. Toothless BABBLES back, perplexed, looking to the clouds above, narrowing his eyes. Hiccup and the Gang follow his stare. Above in the distance, a shape pierces a cloud, pulling a wispy trail in its wake. A gleaming, warbling, mirror-lik form darts between the rounded formations, reflecting the golden cloudscape. As it cruises through the sky, an iridescent white dragon materializes out of thin air. Toothless EXCLAIMS, excitedly.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: The Light Fury!

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: She's following us! The Light Fury blasts a fireball ahead of her and flies through it, pulling a comet trail of flame and smoke. Whe dissipates, she’s gone, having vanished anew. The crowd “OOHs” and “AWWs,” slack-jawed faces grinning i amazement.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Would you look at that?

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Where’d she go? Is she made of sky? Elated, Toothless jackknifes upward, giving chase and CAL out to her.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Whoa! Hold up, Toothless! The Light Fury’s warbling shape proves hard to track as h cloaking ability renders her nearly invisible. Toothless zigzags through the air, leaving the flock far below, determined not to lose her again. She punctures a towering cumulous and explodes out of the top, corkscrewing through the air and pulling wisps. She materializes at the top of her arc, suspended weightless the air. Toothless GURGLES, enamored.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, look who it is! She SNARLS and suddenly dive-bombs them. Hiccup’s smile f as she closes in. She swoops in and attacks Hiccup!  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 45.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uhh-- AGGH! BAM! He’s snatched out of the air. She flaps off with Hic flailing in her clutches...

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh hey, it’s really nice to finally

dialogues.speaker: -- AAGHH
dialogues.text: .»+. and in one dismissive gesture, she hurls him out lik trash. Hiccup tumbles head over feet, plunging toward the sea. The Light Fury turns back to Toothless, GURGLING with a gaping, self-satisfied smile: “There! You’re free.” Toothless looks toward Hiccup, now a plummeting speck. He turns back to the Light Fury, offers a forced smile: “Tha but, uh...” and dives to Hiccup’s rescue, his locked tail encumbering his normal grace. The Light Fury watches, confused and a little insulted. Hiccup plunges past the flock, grimacing in humiliation.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: This is perfect. So great. Toothless dives after him, collecting him back in the sad He preempts their snarky comments.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Not a word. The group snickers. They arc back into the sky, rejoining the flock, as Tooth searches for any sign of the Light Fury. Alas, she’s gone Toothless MOANS, crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the warlords interjects impatiently.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR THE ROCK
dialogues.text: Yes, yes, but where did they go? He picks up a charred stick from a brazier next to him an begins marking the map at his feet with sooty strokes.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 46.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: (muttered) Must I explain this? (aloud, condescending) Night Furies can’t survive in the cold, so they haven’t gone north. He crosses out the lands to the north of Berk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flock of dragons continues flying steadily toward the horizon as Grimmel essentially predicts their every move.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They are trying to put distance between themselves and enemies to the East and South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the map, Grimmel crosses out the lands to the East and South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiccup sees a shape emerging between parting clouds ahead

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And Night Furies cannot fly long distances without rest. A massive monolith of an island rises impressively from t sea, its thousand foot sheared cliffs pushing through a r of clouds. The crowd is silenced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He indicates a hopscotch-like path across islands toward West.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 47.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Their flight path must include stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fishlegs breaks to the front of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: POTTY BREAK
dialogues.text: The convoy ascends the vertical granite cliffs of the towering island, piercing the ring of clouds that surroun it. As they rise above, the spired battlements of sun-kis stone give way to a jaw-dropping valley within.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Therefore they’ve gone... they can only have gone... (beat) Does anyone want to take a guess? A glimmering lake extends across the plateau, surrounded verdant pastures and lush forests. Sparkling waterfalls cascade from the snowy peaks. And at the far end of the l a majestic terraced island sits perfectly poised to look over the golden sunset.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: Anyone? (sounding it out) Whu-whu-whu... Ragnar places his ship piece on the eastern portion of th map.

dialogues.speaker: RAGNAR
dialogues.text: East! Grimmel glares and moves it to the west.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL
dialogues.text: West! Simple! You see? Oh, isn’t this fun? Yes? No. Yes! The warlords leave, disgusted.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 48.

dialogues.speaker: GRIMMEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yes. Where’s your love of the hunt? I thought you were conquerors! You'll have your prize in time. Just allow me a few more days to enjoy this. (beat) I have dearly missed it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence 1101 - New Berk Hiccup dismounts on the terraced new island, surveying th idyllic landscape, as Toothless paces, searching the sky the Light Fury.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Alright. Looks like we’re camping here for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, thank Thor for that! Tuffnut drops to his knees, hands raised to the sky.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Yes! My own place. I plan to build a hut, only for the bearded. Ruffnut, you gotta stay out. Chin whiskers don’t count. Snotlout pushes through them, framing the treetops with h hands.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: I see a tower of manliness in the shape of me. He glares at Eret, unpacking Skullcrusher with flexed and shining biceps. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) It’s gonna be taller that Eret. With bigger muscles.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Get outta my house!  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 49.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Hey, is there a problem here? Snotlout puffs himself up, pressing chest to waist agains Eret.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Yeah, there’s a problem. Ever since you showed up you’ve been trying to upstage me! You’re just so jealous! It’s delusional.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Yeah, delusion’s a good word for it.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Listen, son of Eret! When Hiccup blows it as chief, I’m next in line. Number 2, because I’m clearly Valka's favorite. So, you better start showing me some respect! Snotlout stomps off.

dialogues.speaker: ERET
dialogues.text: Huh. Strange little man. Gobber gives Eret a sympathetic pat.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Don’t mind him. It’s not your fault that you have the body of a Norse god. (beat) I myself have the same problem. He cracks his back and shrieks out in pain. He takes a pi axe from Grump’s saddlebag and plants it in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blacksmith stall goes right here. He recoils in horror when he suddenly finds himself face face with a gaggle of Hobgobblers. He starts counting the confused that they’ve somehow multiplied.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gah! 1, 2... 3, 4, 5... Viking immediately start calling out, staking their claim “This one’s mine!” “I spotted it first” “Bah! I’1ll fight for it!” Etc.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 50.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Okay. Hold on, Gang. I said make camp...

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Did you see them?!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: .--Not build a new village. FUSSY PROTESTS issue from the travel-weary crowd. “Come o “Are you serious?” Etc.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Who died and made you chief? Groans fill the air in unison. Eyes roll. Gothi flies by basket carried by Terrible Terrors. She cracks him on the head with her staff. SNOTLOUT (CONT’D) What? Ow!

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Granted, this place is very nice, but it’s not the Hidden World.

dialogues.speaker: HOARK
dialogues.text: We don’t even know if this Hidden World exists.

dialogues.speaker: ACK
dialogues.text: Yeah, this place is real. The crowd SOUNDS OUT in agreement. Valka chuckles, approaching.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: There’s nothing more stubborn than a mob of tired, hungry Vikings. Hiccup SIGHS.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I guess this can work as a base in the meantime. Defensible. Hidden... (aloud, to the group) All right. You can stay.

dialogues.speaker: GOBBER
dialogues.text: Say hello to New Berk! Let’s get building, lads!  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 51. The crowd CHEERS, tossing helmets.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Until Toothless and I find the Hidden World. BOOS sounds out. Tuffnut pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: TUFFNUT
dialogues.text: Now about that voice. Can we lose the whole honking goose thing? It’s hard to imagine wedded bliss with that going off every minute. Hiccup grimaces and walks off with Valka.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: If you’re going to continue West, I should head back to make sure we weren’t followed. Snotlout appears, grinning.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Great idea. I’1l go with you. For protection.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: (then, covering) Y-you’re far too important here.

dialogues.speaker: SNOTLOUT
dialogues.text: Yeah. He saunters off, chest puffed out.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Just... be careful. He can see that she is holding back.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? Valka considers her words, carefully.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA
dialogues.text: This plan to hide us from the rest of the world... though I wish it were possible, I fear it can’t last, Hiccup. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 52.

dialogues.speaker: VALKA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know I tried to do the same for years, but greedy humans always find a way. I just... I only ask that you think about it. She walks off, leaving Hiccup to consider her advice. He turns to Astrid as she strokes Stormfly affectionately sets about unpacking her saddle.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Do you still think I’m crazy, or...?

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Let’s just say this whole idea is very... you. Hiccup smiles.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for supporting me last night. It meant a lot. She pulls Stoick’s notebook from a crate and hands it to Hiccup.

dialogues.speaker: ASTRID
dialogues.text: Don’t thank me yet. I just hope you're right about this. She walks off, leaving him to contemplate the book.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. NEW BERK - CAMP - HICCUP’S TENT - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: SQ. 1501
dialogues.text: Hiccup has fallen asleep, book on his chest. Toothless slumbers beside him, gnawing the prosthetic leg. Suddenly Toothless awakens, stirred by some unheard sound, and kno Hiccup off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: HICCUP
dialogues.text: (still half-asleep) Toothless, no, it’s too early... Toothless raises his head and twitches his ear plates, following the sound of soft, stealthy patters of feet mov through the camp. The sound of sniffing grows closer.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 53. A moonlit shadow appears on the canvas tent wall, cutting silhouette of the Light Fury. Toothless’ eyes flare excitedly and he quickly slips out the tent flaps... only to find no one there. Between a pair of tents, a dragon outline warbles in the moonlight like a fun-house mirror in movement. It stops, aware of Toothless’ presence. The mirror effect dissipate the Light Fury’s scales cool down, leaving the two dragon staring face to face. Toothless rushes toward her, excited, but she utters a sn stopping him in his tracks with a “Hush, you'll wake them He holds his pose. She slips off between the tents, disappearing from view and he follows. He trots after her, between the tents and palettes of supplies. She lures him away, disappearing, then reappear As she weaves through the camp, their movements fall in s like a kind of dance. She leads him into the pasture beyond the camp. The moonl plays upon her sleek body, glimmering over her rolling shoulders as she slinks through the grass like a lioness. Toothless follows, mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: SQ. 1601
dialogues.text: Toothless zigzags through the woods, determined not to lo the Light Fury again. Finally, he spots her coming to a landing on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+. a sparkling lake-side beach flanked by tall, grassy bluffs. The Light Fury shakes out her wings and folds the rolling her neck in the dim twilight of dawn. Toothless stands at the top of the bluff, looking down at her. She turns, waiting to see what he will do. Toothless tries to look regal and composed and prepares to descend bluff, but he immediately loses his footing on the loosel packed sand. He tumbles down the steep incline, coming to messy landing. He pops up to his feet, shaking off the embarrassing spill. The Light Fury watches him, confused, sits down facing him.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 54. Meanwhile, Hiccup settles in to the bluff above where Toothless was, lying on his stomach to watch while remain undetected. The Light Fury reattempts the invitation to the courtship dance. She settles, awaiting his move. Toothless stares, uncertain of what to do. He glances back toward Hiccup, hidden in the grass. Hiccup mimes, flapping his arms and throwing his head back. Toothless takes the cue and flaps his wings excitedly, beaming a gleeful smile. The Light Fury is unimpressed, a grooms herself disinterestedly. Toothless looks back up at Hiccup for support. Hiccup sta to mime another wing-flapping behavior, but he steps on a twig and dives back into the grass, afraid of detection. The Light Fury looks up toward the sound, but does not se Hiccup. She turns back to Toothless, now looking somewhat wary and suspicious. Toothless smiles awkwardly and begins to hover toward the Light Fury as she eyes him, confused. He gets a little to close and kicks up a spray of sand all over her. Toothless glances back to Hiccup: “What now?” Hiccup tuck his thumbs in his armpits and paces, jutting his head in out like a chicken. Toothless imitates Hiccup, clucking around the beach awkwardly. The Light Fury watches, confused by the strang display. Seeing that it isn’t working, Toothless tries a desperate medley of mating displays, each one more ridiculous than last. Hiccup covers his eyes with his hands, cringing at Toothl disastrous display. As Toothless nears her, she swats at his face like a cat flaps off to a nearby tree, hanging herself inverted from limbs. She snaps her wings closed, covering her face. Toothless approaches the tree and creeps out onto the lim Hiccup waves his hands, miming that it will break under h weight. Toothless misinterprets the signal and begins bouncing on the branch. The Light Fury opens her wings, annoyed, as Toothless bounces her up and down. The limb snaps, sending Toothless crashing head-first int the sand.  HTTYD: The Hidden World - 12/05/18 - Final (DeBlois) 55. He shakes off the dizzying thump as the Light Fury peeks through a wing, then snaps it shut. Toothless shakes his head, frustrated. He eyes the broken branch at his feet and gets an idea.
